properties.description: Grade II-listed Georgian domestic building c.1760, formerly part of Bedford Estate. Interior refurbished 1924-5 to form lecture hall (restored 2014), library, bookshop and offices. Oak woodwork and green Doulton tiles line the staircase.
properties.name: The Swedenborg Society

properties.description: Grade I Victorian Gothic church by G E Street, architect of the Royal Courts of Justice. The recent conservation project reveals the majestic colours of Daniel Bell's painted ceiling, plus Dow Jones Architects' contemporary heritage wing.
properties.name: Grand Junction at St Mary Magdalene Church, Paddington

properties.description: Founded by William the Conqueror's Archbishop Lanfranc in 1080 (the significant crypt survives) St Mary-le-Bow was rebuilt, notably by Wren after the Great Fire and by Laurence King in 1964 after WWII destruction. Home of Bow Bells.
properties.name: The City Churches: St Mary-le-Bow

properties.description: London's main tourist information centre is clad in a specially manufactured system of 220 pre-finished stainless steel panels. The subtly reflective surface provides a striking counterpoint to St Paul's.
properties.name: City Information Centre

properties.description: The independent cultural centre Pushkin House will contribute to this year's Open House Festival through a programme of events and community initiatives at its Grade-II listed building in Bloomsbury Square.
properties.name: Pushkin House

properties.description: 4-storey multi-purpose, state of the art library and archives building.
properties.name: Dalston C.L.R. James Library & Hackney Archives

properties.description: Some of London's best Roman remains, comprising late 2C house with a 3C bath house built within its courtyard. First discovered in 1848.
properties.name: Billingsgate Roman House & Baths

properties.description: Loughborough Pearson's red brick building is unimposing from the outside, but inside is a riot of Gothic Revival design. Golden mosaics reveal the character of the Grade II* listed chapel, built as part of the Middlesex Hospital.
properties.name: Fitzrovia Chapel

properties.description: A redevelopment of Holbornâ€™s community centre improving and increasing facilities  -  the space has been designed by Stirling prize nominated 6a architects and includes a public artwork for the building, created by artist Cargh Thuring. This project is supported by the Mayor of London.
properties.name: Holborn House

properties.description: Our timber frame building was designed by Matrix Feminist Design Co-Operative, and built by women. It represents our community's history of activism-the same ethos that transformed our site from dereliction, into a thriving community garden
properties.name: Walworth Garden

properties.description:
A great little museum set in the Grade 2 listed Ossulston Estate - a prime example of pre-war Social housing - based on Karl Marz Hof in Vienna.
Open Wednesdays to Saturdays throughout Festival 
Sunday 11th Event
properties.name: People's Museum Somers Town

properties.description: Hornsey Library is a Grade II listed building, featuring Huxley-Jones' "Reclining figure" sculpture and the intricately etched glass "Hornsey window". A recent refurbishment has added practical updates while keeping the 1960s aesthetic.
properties.name: Hornsey Library

properties.description: Our 1950's warehouse has been converted to provide a new home for creative studio Acrylicize, to provide a mixture of workshop spaces, co-working and traditional studio space, all centred around a large events and gallery space.
properties.name: The Art House

properties.description: A modern conversion of a 19th-century hop warehouse and a 1980s office building, joined by a striking helical staircase. It is the home of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists and other womenâ€™s health organisations.
properties.name: Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists

properties.description: How can architecture help us to understand a world in flux? We can use buildings as markers of change, seeing the impact of global economic shifts on local streets, the rise and fall of public housing, and the march of 'gentrification'.
properties.name: Walking around Ermine Street, Spitalfields

properties.description:
A plain Victorian Church set in a wooded Churchyard, with a vibrant and striking set of Murals around the altar and the Choir. 
Has indoor toilet facilities. 
A good quality well used organ in good condition, and an excellent accoustic
properties.name: St Mary's Church Bromley

properties.description: Poroban is a multi-disciplinary design studio, based off Old Kent Road, specialising in low carbon building design. We are offering free design surgeries throughout September and are hosting an open day on Saturday 9th Sept.
properties.name: Poroban studio

properties.description:
A concept by Hyatt, Andaz London exuberates history since the 1200's veiled by the new-age decor and a buzzing London neighborhood. 

Step in and explore, as Ryan takes you around for an open house!
properties.name: Andaz London Liverpool Street

properties.description: Studio Weave were commissioned to design an extension to the Grade-II listed Lea Bridge Library in East London, adding a cafe and adaptable community space â€“ to deliver a revived civic heart for the Borough of Waltham Forest. This project is supported by the Mayor of London.
properties.name: Lea Bridge Library

properties.description: In 2023, Bank/Monument station completed a major upgrade that increased the station's capacity by 40%. Yet while much of the Bank/Monument complex is new, the station dates back over 100 years.  This tour will showcase its history.
properties.name: Bank/Monument station

properties.description: A floating roof of sound, GPS-triggered & accessed by headphones & Echoes app to playfully reframe public space as an essential community engagement. One of 15 in an international series drawing on Oskar & Zofia Hansenâ€™s Open Form concept.
properties.name: London Open Form Pavilion of Air

properties.description: Founded in 1840, our church began as a major force for good in the local area. We are still operating as a Church today where it was nicknamed 'The Devilâ€™s Acreâ€™ by Charles Dickens due to great poverty and oppression.
properties.name: Westminster Chapel

properties.description: Architecture for London designed and built a new home for stationers Present & Correct in a heritage retail unit. In a nod to the neighbouring British Museum, cabinets as 'wunderkammer' display the stationery as objects of desire.
properties.name: Present & Correct Stationers

properties.description: This is a newly built and fitted out architecture studio in London Fields. We designed it as a flexible working and event space with the opportunity to align personal wellbeing and professional endeavour in one supportive space.
properties.name: AH A Studio

properties.description:
Yorkton Workshops is a newly remodeled building that merges Victorian features with modern industrial details.
House to the design firm Pearson Lloyd.
We are thrilled to show you what we do and where we do it.
properties.name: Yorkton Workshop

properties.description: Public Tours tours by Architect's DSDHA and the team at National Youth Theatre of the NYT's recently redeveloped RIBA-award-winning building, which created the UK's first theatre dedicated to staging work created by young people. This project is supported by the Mayor of London.
properties.name: National Youth Theatre

properties.description: The Gurdwara exists to serve the local community in the Hounslow and surrounding areas, providing a space within which the community can congregate and worship in accordance with the Sikh faith.
properties.name: Hounslow Sri Guru Singh Sabha

properties.description: A lunchtime guided tour of the Croydon Clocktower exhibition 'Croydon from the palette of Evacustes Phipson'
properties.name: 'Croydon from the palette of Evacustes Phipson' tour
